neg_sample_comments.comment: This is a really terrible device.
When I received it I could not use it because it required Why-fi I went to the library and, because I was not getting anywhere, a friend there loaded on the two books that I wanted loaded.
If you delete them all using a PC connection there is some connected database that I haven't been able to find that re-downloads them when you fire it back up.
I downloaded a couple of ebooks from my computer as soon as I received it but I did not use it.
My iPad does not do this, so wonder why the Kindle does.
First off is the spotty synchronization when reading a book across multiple sources.
I read with the kindle like an hour and I found it as hard on my eyes as my phone so didn't find much advantage of having an extra device and paying extra with no gain.
My only beefs are that it doesn't sync with my iphone most of the time and it's laggy and hard to highlight passages, because of the lag.
While I understand it's an e-reader and is not supposed to be as fast as a mobile phone or tablet I still find it that is sluggish.

If it wasn't for the fact that the screen broke, it'd likely be my take everywhere Kindle.
the screen is great and performance is definitely very different from the old one.
The only thing, there's shadows on the screen.
The advertising states that it is glare proof however it is not .
It is still glare free under the sun.
Bought a cover but for the 1 day I didn't have one, I scratched the screen
I can read my book in the sun, and have no problem seeing the screen.

neg_sample_comments.comment: Uber fragile screen.
The only thing, there's shadows on the screen.
The advertising states that it is glare proof however it is not .
Bought a cover but for the 1 day I didn't have one, I scratched the screen
If it wasn't for the fact that the screen broke, it'd likely be my take everywhere Kindle.

The only issue I've had so far is that the bottom of the screen is darkened a bit, this is only due to the led light placement- it's not really a problem because it does not interfere with the words, I just had to look it up to make sure it wasnt broken.
just wish the screen wasnt so easy to damage.

I really enjoy having the option of the back light when I am in low light environments or reading in bed.
Can see perfectly in bright sun.
Works great in sunlight and reading outdoors.
Great for the eyes and especially those who read at night.
Reads at night in the dark and out in the bright sunlight without any issues.

pos_sample_comments.comment: The touchscreen feels responsive and quite useful for passages or definitions, and the menus and options are well laid out making this E-book easy to use.
Please click "Helpful" if this was helpful!
I've owned a Kindle since it first came out, and have always had the un-lit version with the next/previous buttons on either side.

In my opinion, if you could get paperwhite to read out loud and add page turning buttons  (allowing for one handed reading -great when you're holding a sleeping child in your arms) it'd be the absute best.
Although I like the fact that I can read at night without a lamp clipped to my Kindle,  I miss the buttons to turn the page and the keyboard's ability to read out loud -text to speech.
I wish they had kept the page turn buttons as an option.
Accessing the backlight brightness control could be easier.

sample_comments.comment: Some functions also difficult to find and remember.
Please click "Helpful" if this was helpful!

In my opinion, if you could get paperwhite to read out loud and add page turning buttons  (allowing for one handed reading -great when you're holding a sleeping child in your arms) it'd be the absute best.
but I like to have the page flip button the device rather than touching on screen .
Also they have removed the page turning side paddle buttons which means u use the touch screen which I don’t like.
Although I like the fact that I can read at night without a lamp clipped to my Kindle,  I miss the buttons to turn the page and the keyboard's ability to read out loud -text to speech.
I've owned a Kindle since it first came out, and have always had the un-lit version with the next/previous buttons on either side.

The battery lasts, the backlight is handy, and it's perfectly reliable.
I love the backlight, the size and the lightweight compared to the Kindle.
No regret in purchasing this new Kindle as it is lighter and has an adjustable and sharper looking backlit screen for reading in all lighting conditions.
My first Kindle was the keyboard and it remains my favorite.

pos_sample_comments.comment: Easy wifi hook up, I can download my collections from my Amazon account or make new ones as many as I want on the kindle itself.
Also love the wifi and ability to look up definitions with a touch of our finger.

I know you can do things to extend the battery like switching to airplane mode or turning down the brightness but I like having wifi on to sync my reading progress and I like having the brightness on all the time.
The set-up was quick and painless from thereon, but you may want to prepare to access WIFI if you get one of these.
Has wifi but it works kind of slow, but for what i use it is for the dictionary that is really good when you are reading in another language :)

sample_comments.comment: Hard time getting it connected to the wifi.

I know you can do things to extend the battery like switching to airplane mode or turning down the brightness but I like having wifi on to sync my reading progress and I like having the brightness on all the time.
While reading “Dune” the novel many word definitions were not available unless the Bluetooth was turned on, and this drained the battery like crazy.
Easy wifi hook up, I can download my collections from my Amazon account or make new ones as many as I want on the kindle itself.
A bit of a shame that there's not way to get it started unless you can plug into WIFI.
The set-up was quick and painless from thereon, but you may want to prepare to access WIFI if you get one of these.
The only problem we have is that we don't have wifi and had to order books from a relative's wifi.
Also love the wifi and ability to look up definitions with a touch of our finger.
The only let down is the removal of the 3G option, maybe Kobo next time

pos_sample_comments.comment: Awesome size to bring anywhere - it fits nicely in my purse without taking up too much room
I can update my shelves, purchase ebooks based on my “to read” list .

It's lightweight, can fit in one of my larger pockets, is extremely portable, has a decent selection of reading customization options such as different fonts, text sizes, line-heights, and font weights, and downloading books through the Kindle store is so easy.
I have a room full of hardcover books and I love reading from an actual book
Lots of storage for e-books.
It's small enough to carry in a small compartment of your bag.
besides being cheaper it would take no space in my bookshelves and also enable me to read them in dark.

pos_sample_comments.comment: Great image quality, good contrast.
Sharp clear text with many adjustable settings from font to text size to brightness of the light etc.
The device is very easy to hold and ergonomically it is better than the kobo clara hd which is smaller.

sample_comments.comment: Great image quality, good contrast.
Sharp clear text with many adjustable settings from font to text size to brightness of the light etc.
The device is very easy to hold and ergonomically it is better than the kobo clara hd which is smaller.
Somethings I have problems with are expanding illustrations and that it does not display colour.
It seems the problem is with embedded fonts, but I couldn't figure out what was wrong with my PDFs so I just uploaded image-only versions until this problem gets resolved (if ever).
The page flashes a full contrast opposite before it turns the pages so it sort of blinks.
Wish the device came with some color though .
I'm just a bit disappointed by how much heavier the Paperwhite is compared to my Glo HD.

pos_sample_comments.comment: Backlighting perfect to read in bed with partner wanting to sleep.
Purchased this so I didn't have to strain my eyes on my phone while putting baby to sleep.
As all the apps I have on my phone and I just needed a bigger screen to read before I go to sleep, this kindle is a perfect product for me.

sample_comments.comment: Backlighting perfect to read in bed with partner wanting to sleep.
Purchased this so I didn't have to strain my eyes on my phone while putting baby to sleep.
As all the apps I have on my phone and I just needed a bigger screen to read before I go to sleep, this kindle is a perfect product for me.

Turning on enough light to read a normal book disturbs my wife when she is trying to sleep, but this screen can be dimmed enough to read clearly while emitting way less light then a regular smartphone.
Only issue I have is that it never seems  to shut off, it goes into a sleep mode, so when I got to use it again, sometimes  a week later, it needs recharging.
Love when I can't sleep to just open up Kindle with backlight and read until I am tired.

neg_sample_comments.comment: Love when I can't sleep to just open up Kindle with backlight and read until I am tired.
